thread.title: 100 years of flight for world-famous airfield
thread.title_full: 100 years of flight for world-famous airfield | Meridian - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: 100 years of flight for world-famous airfield
text:
Play video It's probably the best known World War Two airfield in the world.
Biggin Hill in Kent was centre stage during the crucial Battle of Britain.
But its roots go back more than twenty years before that when, in the First World War, a military camp was established on the site.
A special event was held to mark the centenary of Biggin Hill.
We speak to: Wartime pilot Ray Roberts; Bob Ogley, author of Biggin On The Bump and to Shonu Bamrah and Singh Bamrah from Falcon Flying Services.
Last updated Mon 13 Feb 2017
